status.text: President Medvedev expressed his condolences to the people of Australia over the loss caused by the flooding.
Dmitry Medvedev has inspected the construction of housing for military personnel in Podolsk outside Moscow http://twitpic.com/3pd2ux
Meeting with Sergei Kiriyenko on Rosatom's performance in 2010 and its prospects for international cooperation http://krln.ru/PSS5
President Medvedev met with Chairman of the Audit Chamber Sergei Stepashin http://krln.ru/nMS5
Dmitry Medvedev will chair a meeting of the Council for Countering Corruption on January 13.
President: It is important that, post-Olympics, numerous modern sporting facilities should remain for the region's residents and visitors.
Held a meeting on the 2014 games' post-Olympic legacy. Dmitry Medvedev: preparations for the Sochi Olympics have entered their final stage.
Dmitry Medvedev expressed condolences to the families and friends of the victims of the terrorist attack in Alexandria, Egypt.
President Medvedev has sent messages to heads of foreign states and governments congratulating them on the New Year.
Ceremony for presenting state awards took place in the Kremlin http://krln.ru/FZP5
President: The government's main goals in 2011 are to improve the investment climate and to bolster the economy and the defence industry.
President Medvedev co-chaired the final government meeting of the year.
The president signed a law creating the Investigative Committee of the Russian Federation http://krln.ru/pnN5
Dmitry Medvedev signed the decree on adopting 112 as the universal emergency number http://krln.ru/v8N5
President Medvedev has instructed the Prosecutor General to inspect Moscow's airports following massive flight delays http://krln.ru/9NM5
The State Council and the Commission for Demographic Policy have held a joint meeting http://krln.ru/HDL5
President Medvedev: Regional leaders must play a direct role when it comes to relations between different nationalities and religions.
President Medvedev: Ethnic conflicts undermine our society. Vandalism and violence are inexcusable. A criminal's ethnicity is irrelevant.
Dmitry Medvedev: Our country was built by many ethnic groups. We are one country, and we must learn to live with each other in harmony.
The president chaired a joint meeting of the State Council and the Commission for Demographic Policy to discuss interethnic relations.
In responding to TV network executives, President Medvedev summed up this year's results. Find the transcript at http://krln.ru/T9L5
During the live broadcast at the Ostankino studio http://twitpic.com/3j6050
Dmitry Medvedev: officials should not remain in office for unlimited terms. They should make way for the young. We have many talented people
This summer's wildfires exposed flaws in regional authorities, in the insurance system and made clear the need to amend the Forest Code.
Reforming the army: fewer officers and much higher wages. We are consistently working toward this.
On the Khodorkovsky case: neither the President nor any other official has the right to voice an opinion before the verdict has been passed.
People should abide by the law because not doing so is socially unacceptable, not because of fear. This would do a lot to fight corruption.
Dmitry Medvedev: any politician must monitor public opinion, especially on the internet.
The President: public involvement in discussing national issues is no bad thing. The authorities and society must learn to work together.
We need updated laws governing law enforcement, and it would be reasonable to change the name 'police' as well as the system itself.
Dmitry Medvedev: Our law enforcement methods are leftover from the Soviet era, when conditions and society were different.
The President: Unless we get our policy towards children right, we won't have a future.
The ratification of the New START treaty is one key result of the year. President Obama knows how to listen, and is a man of his word.
The President takes questions from TV network heads. Watch it on Rossiya-24, Channel One, NTV and Rossiya-1.
The Russian and US presidents have had a telephone conversation http://krln.ru/2WK5
December 24 at 12 p.m.: "The Year's Results with the Russian President" will be broadcast live on Channel One, Rossiya 1, Rossiya 24 and NTV
Dmitry Medvedev welcomes START treaty ratification by US Senate http://krln.ru/dtK5
Meeting with Russian and Indian filmmakers in Bollywood http://twitpic.com/3ig3lv
Dmitry Medvedev's itinerary in India includes a visit to Agra http://twitpic.com/3ig2ll
President Medvedev at the meeting with Indian students: each democracy is unique, a universal democracy for all countries is impossible.
President Medvedev met with students at the Indian Institute of Technology in Mumbai http://krln.ru/S7K5
Russian-Indian partnership priorities include increasing the trade turnover to $20 billion by 2015 http://krln.ru/R5J5
Latvian president says he supports visa-free travel between Russia and the European Union.
President Dmitry Medvedev views the Latvian president's official visit to Russia as a sign of the political will to bolster relations.
President Dmitry Medvedev has met with his Latvian counterpart Valdis Zatlers.
Dmitry Medvedev: It is the responsibility of regional heads to solve the problems with kindergartens http://krln.ru/CsG5
Kindergarten No 1524 in Moscow. Among the pupils here are children with disabilities http://twitpic.com/3gsaq3
Dmitry Medvedev held a meeting today in Ryazan on additional measures to support law and order http://krln.ru/nSF5
President Medvedev has met with trade union leaders http://krln.ru/tFF5
Medvedev: Routine intelligence work needs to factor in the increased information flow. Meeting with SVR officers http://krln.ru/8jF5
Top-level Russian-Lithuanian talks will be held at the Kremlin on December 20
Dmitry Medvedev held this year's final meeting of @i_russia. His conversation with scientists and business leaders http://krln.ru/7gD5
Construction work on the Skolkovo Innovation Centre starts here http://bit.ly/hGz2dQ
The President will hold this year's final meeting of the Commission for Modernisation at the Moscow School of Management SKOLKOVO.
President Medvedev: All necessary legal measures must be taken to combat the incitement of ethnic hatred.Civil unrest cannot be tolerated.
Dmitry Medvedev: The recent disorder in Moscow must be classified as crime and those responsible must be held to account.
During his meeting with military officers, the President commented on recent events in Moscow, including the civil unrest in Manezh Square
President Medvedev: The CIS has helped preserve cultural and economic ties between countries in the post-Soviet space
Dmitry Medvedev: Draft agreement on the CIS free trade zone will be discussed in late December.
Heads of the CSTO member states have reviewed the organisation's work in 2010 http://krln.ru/F6C5
Dmitry Medvedev: Russia, Kazakhstan and Belarus have established the regulatory framework for the Common Economic Space.
Meeting with the healthcare minister: progress on goals set out in the Address to the Federal Assembly http://krln.ru/QBz5
Dmitry Medvedev met with Belarusian President Alexander Lukashenko. Their meeting focused on cooperation within the Customs Union.
Dmitry Medvedev: Russian-proposed Pan-European Security Pact is likely to win support. Brussels talks: http://krln.ru/9Tx5
Talks have been held with Belgian Prime Minister Yves Leterme. Dmitry Medvedev invited Belgian companies to take part in #skolkovo
The President signed instructions on implementing measures outlined in the Presidential Address to the Federal Assembly http://krln.ru/HKw5
The Israeli prime minister has expressed his gratitude to Russia for its timely help in fighting wildfires http://krln.ru/mpw5
Dmitry Medvedev has awarded film director Andrzej Wajda the Order of Friendship http://twitpic.com/3dj1ey
Dmitry Medvedev: Russia and Poland are focused on resolving problems in our bilateral relations http://krln.ru/7Pv5
The President begins his visit to Poland today. Interview with the Polish media:http://krln.ru/Sdv5
President Medvedev met with the editors in chief of Russia's leading print media http://twitpic.com/3dehtk
The president has ordered the Emergencies Ministry to provide additional resources to help fight wildfires in Israel.
An English translation of the President's Address to the Federal Assembly is available online http://krln.ru/8qq5
Dmitry Medvedev announced that visa requirements would be lifted for 2018 FIFA World Cup ticket holders
Russia's work to declassify documents on the Katyn tragedy continues. Another batch was handed over to Poland today http://krln.ru/wQs5
The president has ordered Emergencies Ministry aircraft to help fight wildfires in Israel.
Dmitry Medvedev: "Each Russian school must have a development strategy for 5 to 10 years."
President Medvedev visited School No. 55 in Izmailovka, Krasnodar Territory in southern Russia http://twitpic.com/3c6wyq
Dmitry Medvedev took part in an Organisation for Security and Cooperation in Europe (OSCE) summit in Astana, Kazakhstan http://krln.ru/tLq5
Everything we do is for our children, so they can live better and be better than us. So their success shapes Russia's future. Let it be so.
European missile defense plan leaves two options: mutual understanding with NATO or a possible arms race, which is not desirable.
The state acquisitions law remains purely aspirational. A massive amount of public money is wasted. It needs to be reviewed and modernised.
The understanding that an official serves the nation rather than decides its fate is the basis of a democratic system
Modernisation gives rise to a smart economy, but also requires smart policies and new standards for government agencies.
We must foster dialogue with those who care about the environment before launching construction of production and infrastructure facilities
There should be no unwanted children in Russia. Child protection agencies must focus on promoting adoption and supporting adoptive families
We will discuss allotting land free to families at the birth of their third and every child beyond that, to build a house or summer cottage
We must improve the quality and accessibility of medical care and social services for mothers and children.
Modernisation is above all for the younger generations. We should not be ashamed of the country we leave to our children and grandchildren
In Skolkovo, tax benefits and government funding for research will be available to anyone who has ideas and meets the qualifications.
Russian-made pharmaceuticals should account for 50% of the market in a few years, up from the current 20%.
Obligatory social insurance payments for small businesses in production and in the social services will remain at 26% in the next two years.
Our main objective for the economy is to bring down the inflation rate to between 4% and 5% within the next three years.
We need to raise generations of free, educated, creative Russians and qualitatively improve people's standard of living.
We need to modernise our economy and create growth incentives in all spheres, taking democratic values as our base.
Russian President Dmitry Medvedev has delivered his annual Address to the Federal Assembly. See the highlights @KremlinRussia_E.
Dmitry Medvedev met with Moscow Mayor Sergei Sobyanin to discuss social benefits, transport and the budget in Moscow http://krln.ru/mWp5
Meeting of the Commission for Modernisation was held. The president discussed legislative issues related to innovation http://krln.ru/TPp5
